intro: Lobelia giberroa var. ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid and cool conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, hairy texture. This rare species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
